titles.ar: بَابُ الِاسْتِرَاحَةِ فِي السَّعْيِ وَ الرُّكُوبِ فِيهِ
titles.en: Chapter 144 – The rest during the Sa’ee and the riding therein

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَطَعَ السَّعْيَ لِلصَّلَاةِ أَوْ غَيْرِهَا وَ السَّعْيِ بِغَيْرِ وُضُوءٍ
titles.en: Chapter 145 – The one who cuts off the Sa’ee for the Prayer, or something else, and the performance of the Sa’ee without being in ablution

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ بَدَأَ بِالْمَرْوَةِ قَبْلَ الصَّفَا أَوْ سَهَا فِي السَّعْيِ بَيْنَهُمَا
titles.en: Chapter 143 – The one who begins with Al-Marwa before Al-Safa, or makes a mistake in the Sa’ee between the two

titles.ar: بَابُ الِاسْتِرَاحَةِ فِي السَّعْيِ وَ الرُّكُوبِ فِيهِ
titles.en: Chapter 144 – The rest during the Sa’ee and the riding therein

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/76)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ السَّعْيِ بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ عَلَى الدَّابَّةِ قَالَ نَعَمْ وَ عَلَى الْمَحْمِلِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the Sa’ee performed  between Al-Safa and Al-Marwa upon the animal. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, and upon the carriage’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah riding on a stumper. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, he can do so as well as on a carriage.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/76)
text: مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَسْعَى بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ رَاكِباً قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ وَ الْمَشْيُ أَفْضَلُ .

en.hubeali: (It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the man who performed Sa’ee between Al-Safa and Al-Marwa, riding. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem, and the walking is superior’.
en.sarwar: 2. Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah riding. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful but walking is more virtuous.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/76)
text: ابْنُ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَطُوفُ بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ أَ يَسْتَرِيحُ قَالَ نَعَمْ إِنْ شَاءَ جَلَسَ عَلَى الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ وَ بَيْنَهُمَا فَيَجْلِسُ .

en.hubeali: Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullahasws about the man who performs Tawaaf between Al-Safa and Al-Marwa, can he rest?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes, if he so desires to sit upon Al-Safa and Al-Marwa, and between the two, so he can sit’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ibn abu ‘Umayr has narrated from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah: if he can rest. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, he can do so on al-Safa’ or al-Marwah or in between.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/77)
text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يُجْلَسُ بَيْنَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ إِلَّا مِنْ جَهْدٍ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from one of our companions, from Aban,
(It has been narrated) from Abdul Rahman, from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘One cannot sit between Al-Safa and Al-Marwa except from tiredness’.
en.sarwar: 4. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla’ ibn Muhammad, from certain persons of our people, from Aban, from ‘Abd al- Rahman who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘You must not sit down between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah unless you are very exhausted.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/77)
text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ الْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ النِّسَاءِ يَطُفْنَ عَلَى الْإِبِلِ وَ الدَّوَابِّ أَ يُجْزِئُهُنَّ أَنْ يَقِفْنَ تَحْتَ الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ قَالَ نَعَمْ بِحَيْثُ يَرَيْنَ الْبَيْتَ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Abdul Rahman Bin Al Hajjjaj who said,

‘I asked Abu Al-Hassanasws about the women performing Tawaaf upon the camel and the animals, are they allowed to be pausing beneath Al-Safa and Al-Marwa?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes, by where they can see the House (Kabah)’.
en.sarwar: 5. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan ibn Yahya from ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of women who perform Sa‘y between al-Safa’ and al-Marwah on camels and stumpers; if they can stop below al-Safa’ and al-Marwah. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, they can do so in a way that they can see the House.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/77)
text: وَ عَنْهُ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَى الرَّاكِبِ سَعْيٌ وَ لَكِنْ لِيُسْرِعْ شَيْئاً .

en.hubeali: And from him, from Muawiya Bin Ammar,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no Sa’ee to be performed by the rider, but it is in order to expedite something’.
en.sarwar: 6. It is narrated from him (narrator of previous Hadith) from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘One riding is not required to perform Sa‘y (walking faster like running slowly) but they should hasten to a certain degree.’”
